column7: Study the engineering principles that govern food processing and preservation unit operations, including evaporation, freeze-concentration, membrane separation, dehydration, centrifugation, and extrusion, and understand the effect of the process conditions of various unit operations on product characteristics and product quality. 2 undergraduate hours. 2 graduate hours. Prerequisite: FSHN 414 or equivalent; FSHN 460 or equivalent; FSHN 312 or FSHN 471 or equivalent. FSHN 260 is recommended.
column9: 2 undergraduate hours. 2 graduate hours. Prerequisite: FSHN 414 or equivalent; FSHN 460 or equivalent; FSHN 312 or FSHN 471 or equivalent. FSHN 260 is recommended.
